subject: Any way to multi-thread tests?
msgSnippet: I ve got a suite of tests for assorted classes, and its all working fine. except it takes too long. By clock, not by resources. One of the classes I m testing
messageBody:
I've got a suite of tests for assorted classes, and its all working
fine. except it takes too long. By clock, not by resources.

One of the classes I'm testing is a working set cache, and in order to
test it, you have to wait until a cycle or two have gone by to let the
mark logic work.

This takes a long time, during which the main JUnit test is just doing a
Thread.sleep(bignumber);

What I'd love to do is start the cache testing code, and then continue
with other tests that are not time dependant while the cache test is
doing the big sleep();

It would not be hard to use Java's concurancy tests to resync things,
but I don't have any idea if, or how, to get subsequent tests to fire off.

Is this possible?

Thanks
Pat
